meanings.definition: To make less intense or severe
meanings.sent1: She mutes the TV when it gets too loud.
meanings.sent2: The volume control mutes the music easily.
meanings.sent3: He always mutes the alarm clock in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The fog mutes the colors of the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The snowfall mutes the usual sounds of the city.

meanings.definition: A device used to silence or reduce sound
meanings.sent1: The theater technician adjusted the mutes on the speakers.
meanings.sent2: The musician used the mute to soften the trumpet's sound.
meanings.sent3: The classroom had various mutes for different instruments.
meanings.sent4: The mute on the microphone helped reduce feedback during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The sound engineer placed the mutes strategically around the room.

meanings.definition: People who are unable to speak
meanings.sent1: The mutes in the community used sign language to communicate.
meanings.sent2: The novel featured a character who was one of the mutes.
meanings.sent3: The group of mutes organized a silent protest in the square.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the mutes played a crucial role in conveying emotions.
meanings.sent5: The mutes found solace in their shared experiences and understanding.
